awd_titl_txt: Cross-Disciplinary Introduction of HPLC to Strengthen       Undergraduate Laboratory Instruction
awd_abstract_narration: Collection of quantitive chemical imformation has become a necessity            for fundamental research in areas such as the neurosciences, molecular          biology, pharmacology, ecology, and toxicology.  Undergraduate                  education must train students entering these fields to understand and           properly apply various types of chemical instrumentation.                                                                                                       Through this project high-performance-liquid-chromatography (HPLC) is           introduced into laboratory courses and undergraduate research projects          in psychology, biology and chemistry.  HPLC experiments are introduced          into five courses within the three departments.  The experiments are            developed through senior independent study projects.  The grantee               provides funds for this project that are an equal match for the NSF             award.
